portfolio.title: Genesis
portfolio.about:
This is the first game I ever worked on.

It is a very personal project that is heavily inspired by Nintendo's Earthbound. It was a fun retelling of adventures with my friends mixed with a world that seemed almost perfect.

Genesis’ soundtrack was composed by FloorBaba & RickyBrugal with the addition of Fluidvolt, Shannon Mason, TobyFox, and many others wonderful composers from the Earthbound: I Miss You album. The game wasn't completed, but I have hopes that one day I will be able to finish this love letter to coming of age.

portfolio.title: Ruby Version
portfolio.about:
My first time composing music and my first time picking up a Gameboy with a different purpose in mind.

The limits of only 4 sound channels, 4 buttons, and a D-Pad to compose allowed me to experiment with audio in ways I had never known to be possible before.

portfolio.title: Results of My:
portfolio.text: A collection of recordings experessing the effects on myself, others and the environment.
portfolio.about: ROM is my first experiment with expressing emotion through music. It is an odyssey of expression with a climatic jump that sums up my final year of high school.

portfolio.title: Paracentric
portfolio.text: A surreal horror RPG made in 24 hours.
portfolio.about: Vexing, Censorship, and just straight out Weird is everything you need to know about Paracentric. This 24 hour game jam project was a hit with fans of surreal horror RPGs and earned itself an award, a 4-star rating with over 600, and a Video Game Tropes page.

portfolio.title: MW Classic
portfolio.text: Prototype abstract platforming at it's finest.
portfolio.about:
MW is the mechanic. Platforming is the idea. Constricting vertical momentum to two buttons encouraged player’s to traverse a minimalistic utopia of pink skies in ways they’ve never thought possible. Till now.

This game is will be released in Q1 of 2017.

portfolio.title: ChexMix LP
portfolio.text: An experimental compilation of experience, influence, and inspiration.
portfolio.about: The ChexMix mixtape is exactly what you think it is, a bag of mixed together songs initially meant to be enjoyed in smaller portions. With the constriction of the 4-bit sound processor of the Nintendo Gameboy I challenged myself to compose over 40 minutes of music that mixed into one another.

portfolio.title: RocMoto
portfolio.about: As love letter to Shoot-em-Ups and aggressively fast anti gravity racers, RocMoto is an experiment in encouraging player’s to engage their enemies instead of dodging them.

portfolio.title: F Mode
portfolio.about: FMode is an abstract breakneck endless runner that turned out to be an overnight success. The concept was developed in 3 hours and expanded to mobile devices within a month. A sequel called FSharp is currently in development.
blurb:
“Unlike alot of endless runners that focus on a solitary gameplay gimmick F Mode throws a whole slew of different potential “game over”s at once. Add in a really neat versus mode that lets friends see who can last the longest without getting gobbled up by digital aquatic life out on a cyber rampage and you’ve got yourself a winner.”

-Craig Forshey Super Game Droid

portfolio.title: Some Place, Some Where
portfolio.text: An experiment with looping game soundtracks.
portfolio.about: An experimentation in looping game music and an existential crisis. This soundtrack was going to be the looping music used in RocMoto, instead, I choose to release the mixtape on it’s own.

portfolio.title: Starlot Derby
portfolio.text: The slickest intergalactic baseball game this side of the universe.
portfolio.about:
Making baseball great again, by developing a baseball game you couldn’t play outside. After long 6 months of development, Starlot Derby has been met with praise from industry professionals and baseball fans alike. As Craig Forshey of Super Game Droid states,

“...there is nothing that even comes close to delivering the sheer zaniness of indie developer Maximum Crash’s psychedelic new arcade batting game Starlot Derby.”

This game went on to win an award and snag a deal with a local baseball team in Worcester,MA and currently has a sequel in the works.

portfolio.title: Reiner.io
portfolio.about: Branding another designer is the challenge of taking the aspects of a person and applying them in its simplest form. The I/O logo turns into the first letter of the client’s name as a way of representing his technological abilities and character.

portfolio.title: Hibachi Hero
portfolio.text: A fast-paced first person food shooter.
portfolio.about:
A first person food shooter about becoming the “Hibachi Hero” was a massive success. As Lead Designer, I designed the mechanics, user interface, and user experience. The tools I developed sped up asset production and allowed our artists to directly interact with the project without writing a single line of code.

Hibachi Hero is also used as treatment for kids who experience behavioral disorders, as opposed to drugs.

portfolio.title: Bravehearts Derby
portfolio.about: Bravehearts Derby is a mobile application that doubles as both a baseball game and an audience engagement app. By establishing the app as both a game and an app I was able to expand the brand globally and improve retention with their fan base off-season. With over 500 downloads and engagement in 7 different countries, Bravehearts Derby was a homerun!

portfolio.title: Woo Game Pile
portfolio.about: As of January 2016 I am a board member of the Worcester Game Pile, a game developer collective in central Massachusetts. In June of 2016, I rebranded the collective and designed a fun and engaging brand that not only represents what we do, but helps to broaden our demographic from only developers to the entire city of Worcester.

portfolio.title: The Boston Massacre
portfolio.text: Proving critical learning through interaction with historical data.
portfolio.about: The Boston Massacre is a classroom history lesson that makes use of modern technology as a way of proving critical learning.  Encouraging engagement with interactive data allowed students to come up with their own conclusions to avoiding the event. As designer and developer I was challenged with creating a web application that could replace a textbook lesson and allow teachers to monitor the progress of their students.

abouthtml:
I'm a Full-Stack Designer and Developer who loves to experiment with interactive experiences.

I've been digitally solving problems for 4 years, while attending Becker College in Worcester, Massachusettes.

I've done design and development for:

  • Web Apps

  • Mobile Apps

  • Games

  • Desktop Apps

  • E-Learning

I run a digital production studio -> Maximum Crash

I'm also a board member of the Worcester Game Pile

In my spare time I teach game development to kids at the Worcester Public Library and like to draw cartoons, skateboard, travel, make chiptune music (I use a gameboy), and take care of my plant (promptly named “dude”).
